intro: Euphrasia rhumica, commonly known as the greater eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Euphrasia rhumica is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for eye conditions.
